        subject - the subject

      • send

        public void send(String from,
                 String subject,
                 String aMessage,
                 boolean isHtml,
                 Map<javax.mail.Message.RecipientType,Object> recipients,
                 List<? extends File> inlineAttachments)
          throws MailModuleException
        Deprecated. 
        Sends a message to the given addresses with a list of attachmens. All the parameters are required (not null)
        The given addresses (java.util.Map) looks like:
        • Key: [MimeMessage.RecipientType.TO,MimeMessage.RecipientType.BCC o MimeMessage.RecipientType.CC]
        • Value: a string (java.lang.String) or an array of strings(java.lang.String [])
        The list of attachments is a file list (java.util.List of java.io.File)
        Specified by:
        send in interface MailService
        Parameters:
        from - the origin address
        subject - the subject
        aMessage - the message (plain texto or html without images)
        isHtml - true if the message is HTML
        recipients - the target addresses (TO,BCC or CC)
        attachments - the list of attachments. Set the inline attribute to true to insert this file inline the document.
        Throws:
        Exception - if something goes wrong
        MailModuleException
